page.title: 16Local History.
page.content: We interviewed Mrs Stevens, one of the dinner ladies at Reculver School because she has lived in this area all her life. She remembers quite clearly being a pupil at the school during the Second World War and the constant noise of planes overhead.Since 1950 she says the ares has changed quite a bit in some ways,the village of Reculver is still a small village but then it had one small caravan site and very few summer visitors.The coastguards cottages were then inhabited and quite a few children from the village attended the school,today there are only two and the coastguards cottages are being demolished.The present sea wall dates from after the floods of 1953 when a lot of the old sea wall collapsed.There were no amusements and no shops that catered for campers or holday makers.
